Problems with In-laws?

Are in-laws getting in the way?

How to maintain harmony with your spouse AND your in-laws

As if I don't have enough problems with my own parents? Now I need to deal with all the dynamics of my spouses family? (And if I thought my family had problems....)

As one very wise woman said: "A mother shouldn't get into a fight with the woman who is giving him (her son) sex."

The Overbearing In-Laws- setting boundaries that work for you .

Don't critisize your partner's parents in front of him, this will only ignite his defenses.

 

Working as a couple- your main priority is your spouse, parents come next. The most important message to send a parent is that your spouse is, and always will be, number 1 on your list of priorities. This is not to say that you shouldn't make an effort to accommodate to your parents needs, it's just that you don't need to accommodate as much as you would to your spouse's needs. Your parents are adults and should be able to take care of themselves, including their social and emotional needs. Your spouse is your partner in life and the point of your relationship is to be there for each other.

Some parents can get insulted by being put second place. But the sooner you make it clear that your spouse's needs come first, the easier it will be in the long run.

When spending time with your in-laws brings out the worst in your spouse

Some people are lucky enough to have in-laws that they get along with, but most people will experience some amount of discourd with their spouse's parents.
